intro: Austroderia splendens, commonly known as the shining flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, erect growth habit. The plant produces showy, spike-like inflorescences that are often bright yellow or orange in color. Austroderia splendens thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is typically found in coastal areas and along stream banks. It plays an important ecological role in supporting native insect and bird populations.
